ground_truth: Harry scrambles up and reaches high above his head for a broomstick as the dragon gets closer and closer, with the Firebolt stuck fast. Harry frees the broomstick as the dragon lashes out and smashes the window to pieces. He falls from a great height, pursued by the Horntail, but reappears out of the mist once again astride his broomstick. A dragon is close behind, and a burst of flame sets the end of Harry's broomstick on fire. It continues to smolder as the dragon zooms after Harry through a stone arch, with the massive viaduct ahead. Harry flies towards it and hurtles through one of the narrow openings at the top. As the dragon tries to bat, its huge wings smash into the brickwork, and Harry and the Horntail plunge into the valley far below. The crowd of spectators in the arena scan the sky with nervous anticipation, with Dumbledore and Fudge looking very concerned. Hagrid shields his eyes as he looks up into the empty sky until a tiny speck appears in the distance, prompting Hermione to scream. Harry hovers for a moment, then aims the Firebolt down towards the gleaming golden egg, triumphantly snatching it up. In a packed Gryffindor common room, the painted characters in the pictures join in the applause, and the twins hoist Harry onto their shoulders. The egg glows as Harry twists it open, and they clap their hands over their ears. Ron appears in the doorway as Harry closes the egg, facing Harry awkwardly as the twins usher everyone away and Hermione shakes her head, bemused. Gray clouds are reflected in the waters of the lake while owls fly in and out of the great hall. Parvati and Padma Patil walk together down the length of the hall and pass the table where Harry and his friends are eating breakfast. Harry sees Cho at the next table, and as her friend points him out, Cho smiles, causing Harry to dribble his drink in embarrassment. Hermione reads the paper as a small boy lingers at Ron's elbow, and Hermione looks curious as he unpacks a strange brown garment and holds it up, revealing white frills. The twins try it, while Ron gets up reluctantly with his shirt hanging out, and Filch starts the gramophone. The twins grin as the girls get up enthusiastically, but none of the boys move until Neville stands up. Later, Harry and Ron find Neville waltzing by himself around the bedroom, wearing his pajamas and a pair of shiny dancing shoes. Ron and Harry approach Cho and her friends, grinning inanely before moving on hurriedly, and Harry smiles at a group of Beauxbatons girls who stalk off. Meanwhile, Hagrid and Madame Maxime are together, and Madame Maxime reaches down to pick something from Hagrid's beard, pops it in her mouth, and licks her fingers seductively. Finally, Hermione, Harry, and Ron sit beside the lake.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Harry scrambles up and a broomstick is reached for high above his head as the dragon gets closer and closer, with the Firebolt stuck fast. The broomstick is freed by Harry as the window is smashed to pieces when the dragon lashes out. He falls from a great height, pursued by the Horntail, but out of the mist, he reappears once again astride his broomstick. The dragon is close behind, and the end of Harry's broomstick is set on fire by a burst of flame. As the dragon zooms after Harry through a stone arch, it continues to smolder, with the massive viaduct ahead. Towards it, Harry flies and one of the narrow openings at the top is hurtled through by him. As the huge wings of the dragon try to bat, the brickwork is smashed into, and the valley far below is plunged into by Harry and the Horntail. The sky is scanned by the crowd of spectators in the arena with nervous anticipation, with Dumbledore and Fudge looking very concerned. As Hagrid looks up into the empty sky, his eyes are shielded until a tiny speck appears in the distance, prompting Hermione to scream. Harry hovers for a moment, then the gleaming golden egg is aimed for by him with the Firebolt and is triumphantly snatched up. In a packed Gryffindor common room, applause is joined by the painted characters in the pictures, and Harry is hoisted onto the twins' shoulders. As Harry twists the egg open, it glows, and their ears are clapped over by them. In the doorway, Ron appears as the egg is closed by Harry, facing Harry awkwardly as everyone is ushered away by the twins and Hermione shakes her head, bemused. In the waters of the lake, gray clouds are reflected while owls fly in and out of the great hall. Down the length of the hall, Parvati and Padma Patil walk together and the table where Harry and his friends are eating breakfast is passed by them. At the next table, Cho is seen by Harry, and as her friend points him out, he is smiled at by Cho, causing Harry to dribble his drink in embarrassment. The paper is read by Hermione as a strange brown garment is unpacked by a small boy lingering at Ron's elbow, and as it is held up, revealing white frills, Hermione looks curious. It is tried by the twins, while reluctantly Ron gets up with his shirt hanging out, and the gramophone is started by Filch. As the girls get up enthusiastically, the twins grin, but none of the boys move until Neville stands up. Later, Neville is found by Harry and Ron waltzing by himself around the bedroom, wearing his pajamas and a pair of shiny dancing shoes. Cho and her friends are approached by Ron and Harry, grinning inanely before moving on hurriedly, and a group of Beauxbatons girls is smiled at by Harry, who then stalks off. Meanwhile, Hagrid and Madame Maxime are together, and something is reached for from Hagrid's beard by Madame Maxime, popped in her mouth, and her fingers are licked seductively. Finally, beside the lake, Hermione, Harry, and Ron sit.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Harry scrambles up and reaches for a broomstick as the dragon gets closer, with the Firebolt stuck. He frees it while the dragon smashes the window. Harry falls, pursued by the Horntail, but reappears on his broomstick. A dragon's flame sets the broomstick's end on fire as it chases Harry through a stone arch toward a massive viaduct. Harry flies through a narrow opening, and the dragon's wings smash into the brickwork, plunging them into the valley below. Spectators in the arena, including a concerned Dumbledore and Fudge, scan the sky. Hagrid shields his eyes until a speck appears, making Hermione scream. Harry hovers, then grabs the golden egg triumphantly. In Gryffindor common room, painted characters applaud, and twins hoist Harry up. The egg glows as he opens it, and Ron appears awkwardly at the door. Gray clouds reflect in the lake as owls fly in and out of the great hall. Parvati and Padma Patil pass Harry's table during breakfast, and Cho's smile makes Harry dribble his drink in embarrassment. Hermione reads the paper while a small boy reveals a strange garment, which the twins try. Ron, reluctantly up with his shirt hanging out, joins in as Filch starts the gramophone. Girls enthusiastically stand, but boys hesitate until Neville stands. Later, Harry and Ron find Neville waltzing alone in shiny dancing shoes. They approach Cho, then move on hurriedly, with Harry smiling at Beauxbatons girls who walk off. Meanwhile, Hagrid and Madame Maxime are together, and she picks something from his beard and eats it seductively. Finally, Hermione, Harry, and Ron sit beside the lake.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Harry scrambles up, reaching for a broomstick as the dragon nears, freeing it just before the dragon smashes the window. He falls but reappears on his broomstick, pursued by the Horntail. Flames ignite the broomstick's end as the dragon chases him through a stone arch toward the viaduct. The dragon's wings hit the brickwork, and both plunge into the valley. Spectators in the arena watch nervously; Dumbledore and Fudge seem concerned. Hagrid scans the sky until Hermione screams, spotting a speck that becomes Harry. He grabs the golden egg triumphantly. In a lively Gryffindor common room, the twins lift Harry as applause erupts. The egg glows, and as Harry opens it, the noise is deafening. Ron awkwardly appears as the celebration ends, and Hermione is bemused. Gray clouds reflect in the lake, owls fly in the great hall, and Parvati and Padma Patil pass Harry at breakfast. Harry sees Cho, smiles, and embarrassingly dribbles his drink. Hermione reads the paper, curious about a small boy unpacking a strange garment with frills. The twins try it, and Ron rises reluctantly. Filch starts the gramophone, prompting enthusiasm from the girls, but only Neville stands up. Later, Neville waltzes alone in pajamas and dancing shoes. Harry and Ron grin inanely at Cho's group, then quickly move. They see Beauxbatons girls, and Hagrid with Madame Maxime, who seductively picks and eats from his beard. Finally, Hermione, Harry, and Ron sit by the lake.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Harry scrambles to his feet in a frantic rush, reaching high above his head to grab hold of a broomstick as an intimidating dragon draws nearer and nearer, with the Firebolt still stubbornly stuck in place. With a surge of determination, Harry manages to free the broomstick just as the formidable dragon lashes out with great force, smashing the window into countless pieces. He then plunges from a dizzying height, closely followed by the relentless Horntail, but soon reemerges from the mist, once again astride his trusty broomstick. The dragon, looming menacingly close behind him, unleashes a fiery burst that sets the end of Harry's broomstick ablaze. It continues to smolder ominously as the dragon zooms after him, chasing Harry through a narrow stone arch, with the massive viaduct looming ahead. Mustering all his courage, Harry flies directly towards it, hurtling through one of the narrow openings at the top. As the dragon attempts to strike, its enormous wings smash into the brickwork, causing both Harry and the Horntail to plummet into the valley far below. Meanwhile, the crowd of spectators gathered in the arena look to the sky with nervous anticipation, their faces etched with concern, as Dumbledore and Fudge exchange worried glances. Hagrid shields his eyes from the sun as he gazes upward at the empty sky until a tiny speck appears in the distance, prompting Hermione to scream excitedly. Harry hovers momentarily, then expertly directs the Firebolt downward towards the gleaming golden egg, triumphantly snatching it up in his grasp. In the bustling and packed Gryffindor common room, even the painted characters in the pictures join in the raucous applause, and the twins lift Harry onto their shoulders in celebration. The egg emits a brilliant glow as Harry twists it open, causing everyone to clap their hands over their ears against the piercing sound. Ron appears in the doorway just as Harry closes the egg, standing awkwardly as the twins usher everyone away, while Hermione shakes her head in bemusement. Gray clouds cast their reflections in the waters of the lake, while owls swoop in and out of the great hall. Parvati and Padma Patil walk together down the entire length of the hall, passing the table where Harry and his friends are enjoying breakfast. Harry catches sight of Cho at the next table, and when her friend points him out, Cho smiles warmly, which makes Harry dribble his drink in sheer embarrassment. Hermione reads the paper, her eyes narrowing with curiosity as a small boy lingers at Ron's elbow, unpacking a strange brown garment and holding it up to reveal white frills. The twins take turns trying it on, while Ron stands up reluctantly with his shirt untucked, and Filch starts the gramophone. The twins grin broadly as the girls rise with enthusiasm and excitement, though none of the boys move from their spots until Neville stands up bravely. Later, Harry and Ron find Neville waltzing by himself around the bedroom, dressed in his pajamas and wearing a pair of shiny dancing shoes. Ron and Harry approach Cho and her friends, grinning inanely before quickly moving on, and Harry gives a warm smile to a group of Beauxbatons girls who then stalk off with purpose. Meanwhile, Hagrid and Madame Maxime are together, and Madame Maxime reaches down delicately to pick something from Hagrid's beard, popping it in her mouth and licking her fingers in a seductive manner. Finally, Hermione, Harry, and Ron sit together beside the tranquil lake, taking in the serene surroundings.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Harry, in a frenzied and desperate motion, scrambles to his feet and reaches high above his head with renewed urgency. His mission is to grab hold of a broomstick while an intimidating dragon draws inexorably nearer and nearer. The Firebolt remains stubbornly stuck in place, testing his patience. Summoning a surge of determination, Harry finally manages to free the broomstick, just as the formidable dragon lashes out with astonishing force, smashing the window into countless shimmering pieces. He then plunges from a dizzying height, closely pursued by the relentless Horntail. Yet, he soon reemerges from the mist, once again astride his trusty broomstick, triumphantly reclaiming his position. The dragon, looming menacingly close behind him, unleashes a fiery burst that sets the end of Harry's broomstick ablaze. It continues to smolder ominously as the dragon zooms after him, chasing Harry through a narrow stone arch, with the massive viaduct looming ominously ahead. Mustering every ounce of his courage, Harry flies directly towards it, hurtling through one of the narrow openings at the top. As the dragon attempts to strike with its full might, its enormous wings smash into the brickwork, causing both Harry and the Horntail to plummet uncontrollably into the valley far below. Meanwhile, the crowd of spectators gathered in the arena looks skyward with nervous anticipation, their faces etched with deep concern, as Dumbledore and Fudge exchange worried glances filled with anxiety. Hagrid shields his eyes from the glaring sun as he gazes upward at the vast, empty sky until a tiny speck appears in the distance, prompting Hermione to scream excitedly with joy. Harry hovers momentarily before expertly directing the Firebolt downward towards the gleaming golden egg, triumphantly snatching it up in his grasp. In the bustling and packed Gryffindor common room, even the painted characters in the pictures join in the raucous applause, and the twins lift Harry onto their shoulders in a jubilant celebration. The egg emits a brilliant glow as Harry twists it open, causing everyone to clap their hands over their ears against the piercing sound that erupts. Ron appears in the doorway just as Harry closes the egg, standing awkwardly as the twins usher everyone away, while Hermione shakes her head in bemusement. Gray clouds cast their reflections in the waters of the lake, while owls swoop in and out of the great hall, diligently carrying messages. Parvati and Padma Patil walk together down the entire length of the hall, passing the table where Harry and his friends are enjoying breakfast. Harry catches sight of Cho at the next table, and when her friend points him out, Cho smiles warmly, which causes Harry to dribble his drink in sheer embarrassment, his cheeks flushing. Hermione reads the paper, her eyes narrowing with curiosity as a small boy lingers at Ron's elbow, unpacking a strange brown garment and holding it up to reveal white frills that puzzle the onlookers. The twins take turns trying it on, while Ron stands up reluctantly with his shirt untucked, and Filch starts the gramophone, filling the room with its music. The twins grin broadly as the girls rise with enthusiasm and excitement, though none of the boys move from their spots until Neville stands up bravely. Later, Harry and Ron find Neville waltzing by himself around the bedroom, dressed in his pajamas and wearing a pair of shiny dancing shoes, twirling gracefully. Ron and Harry approach Cho and her friends, grinning inanely before quickly moving on, and Harry gives a warm smile to a group of Beauxbatons girls who then stalk off with purpose and determination. Meanwhile, Hagrid and Madame Maxime are together, and Madame Maxime reaches down delicately to pick something from Hagrid's beard, popping it in her mouth and licking her fingers in a seductive manner. Finally, Hermione, Harry, and Ron sit together beside the tranquil and peaceful lake, taking in the serene and calming surroundings.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As Harry scrambles to his feet, he quickly reaches up high above his head, extending his arm with urgency and precision, to grasp the broomstick hanging just out of reach, as the dragon looms closer, moving with menacing intent. He strains every muscle to loosen the broomstick, freeing the Firebolt just as the dragon lashes out with fierce aggression, smashing the window into countless glittering pieces that cascade around him. In a heart-stopping moment, Harry falls from an alarming height, with the Horntail in relentless pursuit, yet he astonishingly reemerges through the swirling mist, once again mounted astride his broomstick. With the dragon close behind, a burst of searing flame erupts, scorching the end of Harry's broomstick and setting it alight, leaving it smoldering as the fearsome creature zooms after him with deadly persistence. Navigating the airspace with expert agility, Harry speeds through a stone arch with the massive viaduct looming ahead, accelerating towards it and hurtling through a narrow opening at the top. As the dragon attempts to give chase, its colossal wings collide with the brickwork, causing Harry and the Horntail to plummet into the valley below. In the arena, the crowd of spectators anxiously searches the sky, filled with nervous anticipation, while Dumbledore and Fudge exchange looks of deep concern. Hagrid shields his eyes from the sun, peering into the empty sky until he spots a tiny speck appearing in the distance, prompting an excited scream from Hermione. Harry hovers momentarily, orienting himself before aiming the Firebolt downward, swooping in triumphantly to snatch up the gleaming golden egg. Later, in a Gryffindor common room teeming with excitement, the painted characters in the pictures animatedly join in the applause as the twins jubilantly lift Harry onto their shoulders. As Harry twists the egg open, it emits a glowing light, compelling everyone to clap their hands over their ears to shield themselves from the sound. Ron appears at the doorway, awkwardly facing Harry as the twins tactfully usher the crowd away, with Hermione shaking her head in a mixture of amusement and disbelief. Outside, gray clouds cast their reflections on the lake's surface while owls flit in and out of the great hall. Inside, Parvati and Padma Patil walk side by side along the length of the hall, passing the table where Harry and his friends sit eating breakfast. Harry catches sight of Cho at a neighboring table, and as her friend gestures towards him, Cho breaks into a smile, causing Harry to fumble and dribble his drink in embarrassed surprise. Nearby, Hermione reads the newspaper with rapt attention, while a small boy lingers at Ron's elbow, drawing Hermione's curiosity as he carefully unpacks a peculiar brown garment, holding it up to reveal white frills. The twins eagerly try it out, while Ron gets up with reluctance, his shirt untidily hanging out, as Filch sets the gramophone into motion. The twins exchange grins as the girls rise to dance with enthusiasm, though none of the boys move until Neville, inspired, stands up. Later, Harry and Ron discover Neville practicing his waltz around the bedroom, clad in his pajamas and sporting a pair of shiny dancing shoes. As Ron and Harry approach Cho and her friends, they grin inanely before awkwardly moving on, with Harry offering a smile to a group of Beauxbatons girls, who promptly stalk off. Meanwhile, Hagrid and Madame Maxime share a moment together, with Madame Maxime reaching gently to pick something lodged in Hagrid's beard, popping it into her mouth and licking her fingers seductively. Finally, Hermione, Harry, and Ron find a peaceful moment to sit beside the tranquil waters of the lake.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Harry scrambles to reach a broomstick as the dragon approaches, managing to free it before the dragon smashes the window. He falls from a great height but reappears on his broomstick, pursued by the Horntail, which sets the broom's end on fire. He narrowly flies through a narrow opening in a viaduct, causing the dragon to smash into the brickwork, and both plunge into the valley below. Spectators watch anxiously, and when Harry reappears, Hermione screams. Harry swoops down triumphantly to snatch up the gleaming golden egg. In the Gryffindor common room, the characters in paintings join the applause as the twins lift Harry onto their shoulders. The egg glows as Harry opens it, prompting everyone to cover their ears. Ron appears awkwardly as the twins usher others away, and Hermione shakes her head bemusedly.

Gray clouds reflect in the lake as owls fly around the great hall. Parvati and Padma Patil walk by as Harry and friends eat breakfast. Harry notices Cho, who smiles when pointed out by her friend, causing him to dribble his drink in embarrassment. Hermione reads the paper while a small boy shows a strange garment to Ron, who reluctantly gets up, shirt hanging out, as Filch starts the gramophone. The twins grin as the girls enthusiastically get up, but the boys hesitate until Neville stands up. Later, Harry and Ron find Neville waltzing alone in his pajamas and shiny dancing shoes. They approach Cho and her friends, grinning inanely before moving on, and Harry smiles at Beauxbatons girls who walk away. Meanwhile, Hagrid and Madame Maxime are together, and she seductively picks something from Hagrid's beard and licks her fingers. Finally, Hermione, Harry, and Ron sit by the lake.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Harry scrambles up and reaches high above his head for a broomstick, the Firebolt, known for being the fastest model in the wizarding world, as the dragon gets closer and closer, with the Firebolt stuck fast. Harry frees the broomstick as the dragon, a Hungarian Horntail, one of the most dangerous dragon breeds, lashes out and smashes the window to pieces. He falls from a great height, pursued by the Horntail, but reappears out of the mist once again astride his broomstick. A dragon is close behind, and a burst of flame sets the end of Harry's broomstick on fire. It continues to smolder as the dragon zooms after Harry through a stone arch, with the massive viaduct of the Hogwarts grounds ahead. Harry flies towards it and hurtles through one of the narrow openings at the top. As the dragon tries to bat, its huge wings smash into the brickwork, and Harry and the Horntail plunge into the valley far below. The crowd of spectators in the arena, part of the Triwizard Tournament, scans the sky with nervous anticipation, with Dumbledore and Fudge, the Minister of Magic, looking very concerned. Hagrid, the Hogwarts gamekeeper, shields his eyes as he looks up into the empty sky until a tiny speck appears in the distance, prompting Hermione to scream. Harry hovers for a moment, then aims the Firebolt down towards the gleaming golden egg, a clue in the tournament, triumphantly snatching it up. In a packed Gryffindor common room, the painted characters in the pictures, enchanted to move, join in the applause, and the Weasley twins, known for their mischievous antics, hoist Harry onto their shoulders. The egg glows as Harry twists it open, and they clap their hands over their ears due to the loud screeching noise. Ron appears in the doorway as Harry closes the egg, facing Harry awkwardly as the twins usher everyone away and Hermione shakes her head, bemused. Gray clouds are reflected in the waters of the lake on the Hogwarts grounds while owls, the primary means of communication in the wizarding world, fly in and out of the great hall. Parvati and Padma Patil, identical twin sisters, walk together down the length of the hall and pass the table where Harry and his friends are eating breakfast. Harry sees Cho at the next table, and as her friend points him out, Cho smiles, causing Harry to dribble his drink in embarrassment. Hermione reads the Daily Prophet as a small boy, a first-year student, lingers at Ron's elbow, and Hermione looks curious as he unpacks a strange brown garment and holds it up, revealing white frills. The twins try it, while Ron gets up reluctantly with his shirt hanging out, and Filch, the notoriously grumpy caretaker, starts the gramophone, an old-fashioned record player. The twins grin as the girls get up enthusiastically, but none of the boys move until Neville stands up. Later, Harry and Ron find Neville waltzing by himself around the bedroom, wearing his pajamas and a pair of shiny dancing shoes, enchanted to guide the wearer. Ron and Harry approach Cho and her friends, grinning inanely before moving on hurriedly, and Harry smiles at a group of Beauxbatons girls, students from the French wizarding school, who stalk off. Meanwhile, Hagrid and Madame Maxime, the headmistress of Beauxbatons, are together, and Madame Maxime reaches down to pick something from Hagrid's beard, pops it in her mouth, and licks her fingers seductively. Finally, Hermione, Harry, and Ron sit beside the lake, a favorite spot for reflection.

A dragon is close behind and a burst of flame sets the end of Harry's broomstick on fire. It continues to smolder as the dragon zooms after Harry through a stone arch with the massive viaduct ahead. Harry flies towards it and hurtles through one of the narrow openings at the top. As the dragon tries to bat its huge wings smash into the brickwork and Harry and the Horntail plunge into the valley far below. The crowd of spectators in the arena scan the sky with nervous anticipation with Dumbledore and Fudge looking very concerned. Hagrid shields his eyes as he looks up into the empty sky until a tiny speck appears in the distance prompting Hermione to scream. Harry hovers for a moment then aims the Firebolt down towards the gleaming golden egg triumphantly snatching it up. In a packed Gryffindor common room the painted characters in the pictures join in the applause and the twins hoist Harry onto their shoulders. The egg glows as Harry twists it open and they clap their hands over their ears. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. Ron appears in the doorway as Harry closes the egg facing Harry awkwardly. as the twins usher everyone away and Hermione shakes her head bemused. Gray clouds are reflected in the waters of the lake while owls fly in and out of the great hall. Parvati and Padma Patil walk together down the length of the hall and pass the table where Harry and his friends are eating breakfast. Harry sees Cho at the next table and as her friend points him out Cho smiles causing Harry to dribble his drink in embarrassment. Hermione reads the paper as a small boy lingers at Ron's elbow and Hermione looks curious as he unpacks a strange brown garment and holds it up revealing white frills. The twins try it while Ron gets up reluctantly with his shirt hanging out and Filch starts the gramophone. The twins grin as the girls get up enthusiastically but none of the boys move until Neville stands up. Later Harry and Ron find Neville waltzing by himself around the bedroom wearing his pajamas and a pair of shiny dancing shoes. Ron and Harry approach Cho and her friends grinning inanely before moving on hurriedly and Harry smiles at a group of Beauxbatons girls who stalk off. Meanwhile Hagrid and Madame Maxime are together and Madame Maxime reaches down to pick something from Hagrid's beard pops it in her mouth and licks her fingers seductively. Finally Hermione. Harry and Ron sit beside the lake.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Harry scrambles up and reaches high above his head for a broomstick as the dragon gets closer and closer with the Firebolt stuck fast. Harry frees the broomstick as the dragon lashes out and smashes the window to pieces. He falls from a great height pursued by the Horntail but reappears out of the mist once again astride his broomstick. A dragon is close behind and a burst of flame sets the end of Harry's broomstick on fire. It continues to smolder as the dragon zooms after Harry through a stone arch with the massive viaduct ahead. Harry flies towards it and hurtles through one of the narrow openings at the top. The twins try it while Ron gets up reluctantly with his shirt hanging out and Filch starts the gramophone. The twins grin as the girls get up enthusiastically but none of the boys move until Neville stands up. Later Harry and Ron find Neville waltzing by himself around the bedroom wearing his pajamas and a pair of shiny dancing shoes. Ron and Harry approach Cho and her friends grinning inanely before moving on hurriedly and Harry smiles at a group of Beauxbatons girls who stalk off. Meanwhile Hagrid and Madame Maxime are together and Madame Maxime reaches down to pick something from Hagrid's beard pops it in her mouth and licks her fingers seductively. Finally Hermione. Harry and Ron sit beside the lake.

test_cases.description: Harry scrambles up and reaches high above his head for a broomstick as the dragon gets closer and closer with the Firebolt stuck fast. Harry frees the broomstick as the dragon lashes out and smashes the window to pieces. Meanwhile Hagrid and Madame Maxime are together and Madame Maxime reaches down to pick something from Hagrid's beard pops it in her mouth and licks her fingers seductively. Finally Hermione. Harry and Ron sit beside the lake.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Gerald tumbles down and grasps low beneath his feet for a skateboard as the tiger drifts nearer and nearer, with the Tricycle wedged tight. Gerald liberates the skateboard as the tiger lunges forward and shatters the mirror to dust. He tumbles from a small cliff, trailed by the Elephanta, but emerges from the fog once again atop his skateboard. An eagle is close beside, and a gust of wind sets the edge of Gerald's skateboard ablaze. It continues to flicker as the eagle glides behind Gerald through a wooden gate, with the tiny tunnel ahead. Gerald skates towards it and careens through one of the wide gaps at the bottom. As the eagle tries to flutter, its tiny wings crash into the metalwork, and Gerald and the Elephanta dive into the meadow far above. The group of onlookers in the stadium scan the earth with eager excitement, with Neptune and Jupiter looking quite bewildered. Pluto covers his ears as he looks down into the crowded field until a large shape appears in the foreground, prompting Gretel to giggle. Gerald floats for a second, then directs the Tricycle up towards the shining silver coin, victoriously grasping it. In a sparse Hufflepuff common space, the sketched animals in the murals chime in the jeering, and the triplets lift Gerald onto their knees. The coin shimmers as Gerald spins it shut, and they plug their mouths over their eyes. George appears in the balcony as Gerald opens the coin, gazing at Gerald clumsily as the triplets gather everyone closer and Gretel nods her head, bewildered. White stars are mirrored in the bark of the forest while squirrels hop in and out of the tiny hut. Lavender and Pansy Parkinson stroll individually down the breadth of the chamber and glide past the cabinet where Gerald and his foes are baking lunch. Gerald spots Luna at the prior cabinet, and as her cousin signals him over, Luna blushes, causing Gerald to nibble his fork in humiliation. Gretel recites the book as a giant woman lingers at George's shoulder, and Gretel looks puzzled as she extracts a normal white rock and holds it down, revealing black spots. The triplets wear it, while George sits down eagerly with his jacket tucked in, and Sprout halts the phonograph. The triplets frown as the boys sit eagerly, but none of the girls rest until Trevor sits down. Earlier, Gerald and George spot Trevor tangling by himself against the bathroom, donning his robes and a set of stiff running hats. George and Gerald confront Luna and her cousins, sneering quietly before running off slowly, and Gerald chuckles at a line of Beauxbatons boys who dash on. Similarly, Pluto and Madame Mars are separated, and Madame Mars bends up to drop something into Pluto's hair, flings it at her face, and wipes her chin apathetically. Gradually, Gretel, Gerald, and George stroll along the mountain.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Harry, pursued by a dragon, frees his broomstick and narrowly escapes as the dragon crashes, allowing him to seize a golden egg. In Gryffindor common room, he’s celebrated, with the twins lifting him onto their shoulders. Later, Harry faces an awkward moment with Ron after opening the egg, while at breakfast, Harry embarrassingly spills his drink when Cho smiles at him. Ron and Harry approach Cho and her friends but awkwardly move on. Meanwhile, Hagrid shares a flirty moment with Madame Maxime. Finally, Hermione, Harry, and Ron relax by the lake.
